dialog

Interface DialogFlow

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFlow, InfoFlow, PreferencesFlow, RecommendFlow, SearchResortFlow, StartFlow

    public interface DialogFlow
    General interface to access a flow implementing a certain behavior. The chat bot logic can be very easily extended in the following way. Extend AbstractFlow and implement methods defined in this interface.
    Author:
    ivan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.telegram.telegrambots.api.methods.send.SendMessage continueFlow(org.telegram.telegrambots.api.objects.Update updates)
      Gives all consequent responses to a user within the flow.
      java.util.List<org.telegram.telegrambots.api.methods.send.SendMessage> initFlow()
      Called when a user types a command that is initiating a flow.
      boolean isFinished()
      All dialog flows must maintain internal state and let other classes know if the current flow is finished or no.

    • Method Detail

      • initFlow

        java.util.List<org.telegram.telegrambots.api.methods.send.SendMessage> initFlow()
        Called when a user types a command that is initiating a flow.
        Returns:
        First message to the user from the flow.

      • continueFlow

        org.telegram.telegrambots.api.methods.send.SendMessage continueFlow(org.telegram.telegrambots.api.objects.Update updates)
        Gives all consequent responses to a user within the flow. It intentionally does not throw any exception, in order to encourage a developer to deal with user interactions in a safe way!
        Parameters:
        updates - contain user message related info.
        Returns:
        Next response to the user.

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        All dialog flows must maintain internal state and let other classes know if the current flow is finished or no.
        Returns:
        true if the flow has been finished, false otherwise.
